column4: Hi I've installed libnss-ldap, this installs some other packages as well, somehow the configuration done by me was not ok but after an purge/install it does not ask the configuration questions again
I've tried dpkg-reconfigure but this is not helping
how do i get an package to ask config questions again??
what you want to know about it ?
srry talked to wrong person
, I want it to ask the questions again from first install admin dn, ldap host etc etc
I tried purge and removed all configfiles but somehow these do not get reinstalled as well :-(
the wiki about ldap auth talks about configfiles that I think are obsolete in karmic..
might be, many things changed from older wikis, suffer that, too
but you know how to trigger an package to reconfigure itself ?
I haven't followed your whole story, dpkg is the right tootl for that
I want an package to ask me again the initial configuration questions
: which package ?
i think auth-client-config
: second, trying
i found it
wrong package its ldap-auth-config
no such package
dpkg-reconfigure ldap-auth-config works though
heh, you're fast !!
if only it would actually connect to my ldap server
that was no problem in jaunty karmic doesn't work :-(
yep, the upstart-changes
doesn't even try to connect
